programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to hit a high pay-off with a low buy-in while Darrell and Brandon limp into a locker that may leave them all wet.

programme.title: Forged: Man At Arms
programme.sub-title: Man at Arms: Art of War
programme.desc: The team gets to work on the Arsti Thursting Spear and the Akinaka short sword, two weapons that helped to build the ancient Persian Empire.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: In the Wildfire Round, the chefs try not to crack under pressure. Then it is Fight or Flight in the Crossfire Round.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The Laguna brothers return to the mysterious island off Nova Scotia that is believed to be protected by a powerful curse, aiming to unearth its hidden treasures.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The swampers reflect on the most memorable moments of the series, recalling their greatest triumphs as well as the dangers they have faced.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie and his crew retrieve a stolen vehicle that crashed 500ft down into a ravine. Plus, after a tough winter, Adam considers leaving the Alberta operation.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Five new contestants, James Acaster, Jessica Knappett, Kerry Godliman, Phil Wang and Rhod Gilbert, complete a series of tasks.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Doon Mackichan, Jimmy Carr, Dara O Briain and Alan Davies wax lyrical on subjects including endings. Comedy panel game, with Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting..

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Doc Martin star Martin Clunes hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from June 2016, with comedian Jason Manford and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines that week.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Matt Lucas, Holly Walsh and Susan Calman join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig opens her post in a post-themed edition. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Crackanory
programme.desc: In 1850, a man wakes after a long illness and finds he is being cared for by strangers - but isn't allowed to leave. Read by Anna Friel.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright decides to buy a guard dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright attends a former customer's funeral, leaving Granville in charge of the store. However, the miserly shopkeeper has difficulty trusting his nephew to run it properly.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam and Harry investigate when a gruesome, partly mummified corpse is found after a lorry crashes into an old factory building. The forensic experts attempt to identify the remains by reconstructing the skull, while DCI Telford and DS Linden track down a woman who claims the body is that of a former boyfriend who disappeared seven years previously. It soon transpires that the deceased had unsavoury connections. Benedict Cumberbatch makes an early screen appearance, alongside stars Amanda Burton, William Gaminara and Tom Ward.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team search desperately for casualties as the fire on the private railway line blazes on. Meanwhile, Carole confronts Martin.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B Company's new commander is unimpressed by his men's performances, and Dave's personal problems take their toll.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Joe competes in a boxing match, with the odds favouring him to win. Meanwhile, Collette sets her heart on a wedding Jo cannot afford.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Abra tells a patient he will be able to get his hands on HIV medication for her brother in Zambia, but as he searches for drugs in the basement with a torch, Ric sneaks up on him and turns the light on. Meanwhile, Elliot works a night shift to take his mind off Gina, and Matt tries to scare Donna by talking about the paranormal.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An emergency prompts Duffy to tell Andrew she's pregnant, and a lonely widower clashes with his neighbour over a large wooden Santa. Meanwhile, Charlie worries about Barney's seemingly uncontrollable temper, and Patrick receives bad news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard reveals his true colours to Bianca. Natalie delivers some shocking news. Ian decides to claim his inheritance; where does this leave Mark? Phil gets another bargain.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Bianca finds out that Richard is not easily fooled.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: On an exchange trip to Holland, Nick is reunited with Marianne. Meanwhile, Blue Watch are called to a blaze at a fire station.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack and Beth disagree over the treatment of a young patient with a heart defect, while Sarah and Will's marriage deteriorates as their financial problems mount.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Harding announces his plans for the factory and whether he and Alice intend to stay in Skelthwaite permanently, while Sally and Billy make an important decision about their future. At the village summer fete, David and Anna go public about their relationship and are stunned by a surprise from Luke.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: A stranger asks for help with a leaking car radiator shortly before police turn up at the house, but it transpires he has a hidden agenda. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene spots an opportunity to have her old possessions assessed by experts when the Antiques Roadshow arrives in Ludlow, and the farm's staff all share the same idea. However, it turns out that Boycie, with help from Tyler, is the only one to discover a truly valuable item. Fiona Bruce guest stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour invents a car safety device and as soon as he hears Nora Batty is to attend its demonstration, Compo volunteers to be the dummy that tests it. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio decide there is profit to be made from a heatwave, so Seymour designs a vendor's side car cooler to put Compo into business as an ice-cream man. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Charlie is appointed to defend an animal rights activist accused of murdering an eminent scientist - a case that will be heard before her father. The defence barrister's support for her client's cause leads her to make a series of unprofessional outbursts in court, while Jo's relationship with Marc Thompson creates tension.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A police cadet's body is found, and it soon transpires that his demise mirrors the death of another murder victim killed months previously. When Sam Ryan and her forensic team investigate, they discover the dead man's training college could prove vital in solving the crime. Acclaimed drama series, starring Amanda Burton, with a guest appearance by Tim Healy.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The final three contenders have just two minutes to select from the larder containing a stunning array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to work in conjunction with crab meat. They then have 25 minutes to concoct a sumptuous meal. With a trio of Mediterranean-ispired crab dishes on the menu, judge Rosemary Shrager faces a mouth-watering feast before she must make the ultimate decision, upon which rests a £1,000 cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Actor Kris Marshall chats about new film Trick or Treat, recent work in Jane Austen adaptation Sanditon, and life under lockdown in Somerset.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends from Birmingham answer top 10 list questions on subjects including the Olympic Games, West End Musicals and National Parks. Will they be able to score a Perfect 10 and win a big cash prize? Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: In the final episode of the ninth series, Martin rushes to Ruth's for a medical emergency, and preparations for Morwenna and Al's wedding do not go to plan. Elsewhere, Martin takes his final GMC assessment under the watchful eye of eminent surgeon Bernard Newton, who monitors Martin's skills in assisted surgery. Starring Martin Clunes, Tom Conti, Caroline Catz and Jessica Ransom.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the quiz, with six more contestants competing in Fastest Finger First to see who will sit in the hot seat and have the chance to take home the £1million jackpot. To make things easier, the players have four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help two more people who were found as babies after being abandoned to track down their birth families. Simon Jeffery was left in a box outside a railway tavern in Greenhithe, a story which hit the headlines but which he only learned about by chance at the age of 10. Fi Beazer was discovered in a public toilet in Warminster when she was only a few hours old. Both have spent their adult life trying to track down their parents, and submit DNA samples in the hope of finally getting the answers they seek.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever
programme.desc: Part two of two. Members of the dance troupe the Roly Polys reunite on stage to reminisce about working alongside Les and Les's wife Tracy Dawson reunites with karaoke superfan Penny Morgan, who was given the opportunity to perform the duet of a lifetime on Cilla Black's Surprise Surprise in 1993.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How toilet paper is produced from trees, the making of absinthe and how cricket balls are made tough enough to face test match batsmen.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Rick Petko gets a surprise when Paul Teutul Sr starts to build a bike for him. Mikey Teutul comes in to help and add a touch of inspiration.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The Soviet aviation industry's diverse use of helicopters, from dumping concrete on Chernobyl to warfare in Afghanistan.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to Ohio to check on the Common Tern population, and plugs an abandoned mine shaft in northern California.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew heads to the birthplace Peugeot RCZ R, revealing the vehicle's inner workings and gorgeous exterior.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: An insight into the creation of the Ariel Atom 3S, high-performance, bespoke sports cars that are custom-built at the manufacturer's facility at Virginia International Raceway.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating seemingly simple modern-day objects. This time, how rowing machines, Parma ham and London Underground signs are made.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace-mechanic Sam Lovegrove arrive in Cornwall, looking for something to buy, restore and sell on for a handsome profit. At a windswept hilltop farm they find cars, tractors and a very rare German scooter.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.sub-title: Hot Rods, Trucks and Miniture Bikes
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in the New Forest, looking for things to buy, restore and sell for profit, where they meet Stumpie, an Americana fanatic whose sheds are full of rare bicycles, classic sportsters and pimped-up saloon cars.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An arctic hurricane decimates the crab grounds, forcing captains Elliot Neese and Scott Campbell Jr to make some tough decisions.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Surrey, a house is pulled to the ground and the team members seek original fixtures to sell for profit. In Cambridgeshire, metal traders break down massive machines.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to prove he can make money on a car without spending a fortune, while Edd China turns his attention to restoring a Mercedes-Benz SLK on a very tight budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini takes a Chrysler CG Imperial LeBaron Dual Cowl Phaeton to Kuwait's Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enthuses about a 1931 Ford Model A Starlite coupe hot rod that won the Autoram as it goes under auction without a reserve.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: A look at the development of the Rolls-Royce Wraith, marketed by the company as a 'gentleman's GT'.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Fire Crew's season rests on a knife-edge as they battle their way back from a disastrous setback. The Opal Queen battles rock hard walls alone, desperate to find opal.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Winter arrives in Dutch Harbor and the fleet prepares to hunt opilio crab, but before any lines are thrown a deckhand quits and two brothers fight, with one going overboard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Junk experts Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit Dan, a born-and-raised New Englander whose collection might turn out to be off-limits.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire and Norfolk in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Hampshire, an old leisure centre is torn to the ground. Then, in Lincolnshire a team scour military settings for old weaponry that can be turned into cash.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin tackles a deal that could make or break him. The Boulder Boys race to save their claim from a monsoon flood, while the Cooke Brothers finally make a valuable discovery.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard meets an Oxfordshire aristocrat who owns his own steam train, and picks up an American sign and a Victorian oil lamp.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: The arrival of a 747 Jumbo Jet has the team members itching to dismantle this giant of the sky. However, they immediately struggle fitting it into the parking bay.

programme.title: Steel Buddies
programme.desc: Michael embarks on some shopping trips to the US, tries to get his airplane business of the ground and races to deliver three school buses to Savannah port on time.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of insulin from a loaf of bread, the manufacture of rigging for ships and how green salad is cultivated on scorching desert planes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of the world's most powerful locomotive, how cows' milk is turned into clotted cream, and the crafting of a boomerang from a piece of wood.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Law enforcement officials in Washington, DC vow to bring a gang and its leader to justice when one member kills two FBI agents.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An insight into how a murder can be solved by simple scraps of evidence such as dirt on shoes or a small piece of plastic.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When 69-year-old Ina Clare Richardson was found brutally murdered in a park, police turned to security cameras to piece together the puzzle of her death.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The stabbing of Arkansas cheerleader Julie Heath in October 1993. Eric Nance raped and murdered the 18-year-old, and 12 years later was put to death for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a man who abducted a girl from a bus stop before assaulting her fled from the police, leaving a trail of theft and violence.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Scott Wernick is unable to save the life of an emaciated horse, but later witnesses the birth of a calf.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to Abu Dhabi after a special invitation to visit an extraordinary veterinary hospital, where sick and injured falcons are treated like royalty.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride who loves peacocks and another who loves purple battle with their bridesmaids, while another prays pink dresses will save her wedding day.
